overview_of_class: This course is designed to introduce students to statistics, including both descriptive statistics (summarizing data obtained from a sample) and inferential statistics (drawing inferences about a population based on data obtained from a sample drawn from that population). The assigned readings have been selected to familiarize students with basic concepts relating to the analysis and interpretation of data. Class activities will focus on how the concepts can be applied. Through completion of the course, students should become more sophisticated and critical consumers of statistical information.
name: Statistical Methods in Psychology
class_attributes:
Formal Studies Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Prerequisites apply, see description
subject: PSYCH
